content: **the pattern will be available at the start of the cal on 17 april 2024** create a knitted or crocheted cushion with a duplicate stitch or cross stitch motif of a blue tit liz s designs beautifully combine stitching techniques with knitting or crochet showcasing the remarkable colours of this sweet bird this ckal is suitable for intermediate through to advanced crocheters or knitters kits are available via scheepjes retailers worldwide see the knit version here https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/dawn-chorus-ckal---blue-tit-cushion-knit share projects and find support in the scheepjes facebook groups international english https //www facebook com/groups/scheepjescal international dutch https //www facebook com/groups/scheepjescal **about the blue tit cushion pattern** a tips & tricks pdf with a summary of the materials gauge/gauge measurements pattern notes and chart notes plus additional technical information will be issued one week prior to the start of the ckal liz will be releasing blogposts and helpful tips throughout the four weeks of the ckal typically on wednesdays at 12 noon cest the information provided by liz will include videos extra photos handy tips and additional details to aid participants **about the crochet pattern ** 45 x 45cm 173⁄4 x 173⁄4in square cushion blocked bird motif worked in cross stitch technique additional project materials required not included in kit 2 5mm and 4mm crochet hooks cushion insert stitch marker **about the designer** as a child liz s grandmother taught her how to make toys and her mother introduced her to knitting liz returned to craft after working and bringing up three daughters in the uk taking part in many creative courses workshops and stitching and knitting groups liz most enjoys creating accessories and items for the home and has designed for scheepjes since 2017 she has since contributed over 35 projects to scheepjes using crafts including crochet cross stitch freestyle embroidery punch needle and knitting her designs often combine more than one crafting technique find out more about liz at bizzymitts com or on the scheepjes website at https //www scheepjes com/en/friends/bizzymitts/
